actions-list.actionItem: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to without objection.
Considered by unanimous consent. H. Res. 1611 — "Providing for the printing of a revised edition of the Rules and Manual of the House of Representatives for the One Hundred Nineteenth Congress."
Mr. Graves (LA) asked unanimous consent to consider as introduced.

Pursuant to 2 U.S.C. 285c, and the order of the House of January 9, 2023, the Speaker appointed Mr. Brian Lindsey as Law Revision Counsel of the United States House of Representatives, effective October 2, 2024.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8689.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Graves (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8689 — "To require Amtrak to publicly disclose certain bonus compensation paid to Amtrak executives, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 9541.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Graves (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 9541 — "To amend the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to authorize Federal agencies to provide certain essential assistance for hazard mitigation for electric utilities, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 7671.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Graves (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 7671 — "To amend section 324 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to incentivize States, Indian Tribes, and Territories to close disaster recovery projects by authorizing the use of excess funds for management costs for other disaster recovery projects."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2672.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Graves (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2672 — "To amend the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to provide for the authority to reimburse local governments or electric cooperatives for interest expenses, and for other purposes."
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2892.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Graves (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 2892 — "To direct the Comptroller General of the United States to conduct a study on the effectiveness of local alerting systems, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 310.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Graves (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 310 — "To establish an advisory group to encourage and foster collaborative efforts among individuals and entities engaged in disaster recovery relating to debris removal, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3613.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Graves (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3613 — "To require Facility Security Committees to respond to security recommendations issued by the Federal Protective Service relating to facility security, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 50.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Graves (LA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 50 — "To amend the Federal Water Pollution Control Act to require the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to give priority consideration to selecting Pensacola and Perdido Bays as an estuary of national significance, and for other purposes."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 4367.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Graves (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. S. 4367 — "To provide for improvements to the rivers and harbors of the United States, to provide for the conservation and development of water and related resources, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3475.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Graves (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 3475 — "To amend title 49, United States Code, to allow the Secretary of Transportation to designate an authorized operator of the commercial driver's license information system, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 1478.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Graves (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. S. 1478 — "To designate United States Route 20 in the States of Oregon, Idaho, Montana, Wyoming, Nebraska, Iowa, Illinois, Indiana, Ohio, Pennsylvania, New York, and Massachusetts as the "National Medal of Honor Highway", and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.

actions-list.header: ADJUSTMENT OF THE WHOLE NUMBER OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Under clause 5(d) of rule XX, the Chair announced to the House that, in light of the resignations of the gentleman from New Jersey, Mr. Kim and the gentleman from California, Mr. Schiff, the whole number of the House is 431.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Larsen of WA to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 9.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Dale W. Strong to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
